      • storeCharacter

        public void storeCharacter(DBTransaction transaction,
                           java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String character,
                           RPObject player)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException,
                           java.io.IOException
        This method stores a character's avatar in the database and updates the link with the Character table.
        Parameters:
        transaction - the database transaction
        username - the player's username
        character - the player's character name
        player - the RPObject itself.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is any problem at database.
        java.io.IOException

      • loadCharacter

        public RPObject loadCharacter(DBTransaction transaction,
                              java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String character)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException,
                              java.io.IOException
        This method loads the character's avatar associated with this character from the database.
        Parameters:
        transaction - the database transaction
        username - the player's username
        character - the player's character name
        Returns:
        The loaded RPObject
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is any problem at database
        java.io.IOException

                                                                  java.lang.String username)

                                                                  java.io.IOException

        Returns:
        The loaded RPObject

      • isCharacterCreationLimitReached

        public boolean isCharacterCreationLimitReached(DBTransaction transaction,
                                               java.lang.String username,
                                               java.lang.String address)
                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               java.sql.SQLException
        is the character creation limit reached?
        Parameters:
        transaction - the database transaction
        username - username of account
        address - ip-address of client
        Returns:
        true if too many characters have been created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an input output error
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is any problem at database
